ygData.subject: Re: Compiling issue with demo.cpp
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Thanks for all the help..Finally i got the examples to compile and link. Things worked out once i used the multithreaded dll library to link. Shyam.

Hi, Thanks for all the help..Finally i got the examples to compile and
link=
. Things worked out once i used the multithreaded dll library to
link. 
Shy=
am.


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "shyam_umd" <shyam_umd@...> wrote:
>
=
> Hi Bert, Thanks for the clarification. I followed the steps in the
> pres=
entation and have now got the lib library. But i still have one
> more prob=
lem. I was trying to build the cxx examples project but in
> the linking st=
ep it fails as it is unable to find the cvode.lib file
> and the recipes.li=
b file. I tried to look for the cvode.lib file but
> couldnt find it. Also =
i tried to run the configure script that comes
> with the sundials package =
using cygwin but was unable to get it to
> work. Would you have any suggest=
ions to fix this. Thanks in advance,
> Shyam.
>

> --- In cantera@yahoog=
roups.com, "Bert Bell" <robert.bell@> wrote:
> >
> > The Cantera msi instal=
ler only includes the stuff you need to run
> Cantera
> > with Python and M=
atlab.
> > 
> >  
> > 
> > For C/C++ development  download the Cantera 1.7 =
source zip and build
> > Cantera.  One of the projects is SetupCantera and =
another
> SetupCanteraLite
> > (what already have installed).  I always bui=
ld SetupCantera and then
> from
> > that projects release directory I run S=
etup (It requires
> uninstalling the
> > current cantera install)  You will=
 then have the include files and
> the lib
> > files needed for building Ca=
ntera C/C++ applications, including a
> C++ .NET
> > solution that has the =
demo project setup for building.

uce any lib
